title.narrative: IOM – Multi Country Humanitarian Assistance – CAP 2021

description.narrative: The revitalization of the South Sudanese peace process offers new opportunities for the country and its conflict-affected population. The prospects for peace and development are encouraging and may begin to generate some confidence for durable solutions including returns, relocation or local integration. Although the intensity of the conflict has reduced since the signing of the peace agreement, the country is still facing devastating human and economic costs resulting from the complex protracted crisis, with ongoing localized and sub-national violence and increasingly severe seasonal flooding contributing to overall humanitarian needs. South Sudan remains one of the most complex humanitarian operating environments, with deteriorating infrastructure, cumulative effect of long and heavy rainy seasons and several armed groups still present and active in various parts of the country. To inform the inter-agency response and address the complexity and volatility of mobility dynamics and humanitarian conditions in the country, IOM through this project, continues the activities of its Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) unit, providing granular data and analysis on displacement, human mobility dynamics and humanitarian needs and vulnerabilities for the humanitarian response as well as transition, development and public health partners.
